Groups.Group: Red Hat Software Collections 1 for RHEL 6
Red Hat Software Collections 1 for RHEL 7

Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk devtoolset-3
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: devtoolset-3 bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description:
Updated devtoolset-3 packages that fix two bugs are now available for Red Hat Developer Toolset 3.1. Red Hat Developer Toolset is a Red Hat offering for developers on the Red Hat Enterprise Linux platform that provides current versions of the GNU Compiler Collection (GCC), GNU Debugger (GDB), Eclipse development platform, and other development, debugging, and performance monitoring tools. The devtoolset-3 package is the main meta package of the devtoolset-3 Software Collection and installs other Red Hat Developer Toolset 3.1 packages as dependencies.
The devtoolset-3-build package has been updated to a later version, which requires the updated maven30 Software Collection from Red Hat Software Collections 2.0. As a result, customer rebuilds of Red Hat Developer Toolset 3.1 are now supported. (BZ#1211655)
This update also fixes the following bug:
* The devtoolset-3 package no longer requires the javapackages-tools package for rebuild. (BZ#1218605)
Users of devtoolset-3 are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
